page.title: 01Settlements along A1 Road
page.content: The area varies in height from 700 ft in south to the valley of the Eye water in the north. The River Eye is a dominant feature in the area as it meanders its way along the valley, with wet lowlands serving as a route which the main A1 road south and the main line railway follow. The development of these communications has led to various settlements being built up. Granshouse Handwood, Renton, Harelanside Grantshouse is the largest and is the local service centre and has developed in recent years with a number of transport cafes and picnic sites. The closure of the railway station and the churh as also affected Granshouse. The surrounding land is predominantly intensively farmed for grasses and hay on the lower slopes with rough grazing on upper slopes. The planting of trees is a dominant
